com.abmash.api.browser

Class Debug

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.abmash.api.browser.Debug

  • public class Debug
extends java.lang.Object
    Additional debug methods for developers, used by calling Browser.debug().

    This class can be used to highlight elements on the page or to stop the execution until a button is pressed.

    Author:
    Alper Ortac

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Debug(Browser browser)
      Constructs new BrowserDebug instance for additional debug methods for developers.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void breakpoint()
      Debug method which stops the execution of the application and creates a "Continue" button at the top-left corner of the page.
      void highlight(HtmlElement element)
      Debug method which highlights the given HtmlElement with a red dashed border.
      void highlight(HtmlElements elements)
      Debug method which highlights all given HtmlElements with a red dashed border.
      void highlight(java.lang.String query)
      Debug method which searches for an element with the given query string and highlights it with a red dashed border.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Debug

        public Debug(Browser browser)
        Constructs new BrowserDebug instance for additional debug methods for developers.
        Parameters:
        browser - Browser instance to work with

    • Method Detail

      • highlight

        public void highlight(HtmlElement element)
        Debug method which highlights the given HtmlElement with a red dashed border.
        Parameters:
        element - the element to highlight

      • highlight

        public void highlight(HtmlElements elements)
        Debug method which highlights all given HtmlElements with a red dashed border.
        Parameters:
        elements -
        See Also:
        highlight(HtmlElement)

      • highlight

        public void highlight(java.lang.String query)
        Debug method which searches for an element with the given query string and highlights it with a red dashed border.
        Parameters:
        query - the element to highlight

      • breakpoint

        public void breakpoint()
        Debug method which stops the execution of the application and creates a "Continue" button at the top-left corner of the page. When the button is clicked, the execution continues.
